Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a spiritual energy that the Japanese strongly held in that age—even through a cinema verite’ that has never been attempted in Japanese comedy.

Okay. Here's the thing. I've read through the comments of other viewers --- some trashing the film and some saying it's the funniest, most enjoyable work of kung-fu ever. I really do want to agree with the latter. The action isn't groundbreaking, or unique, or even exceptionally flashy, yet it's the sheer goofy cleverness of the fight, comedic plot dynamic, and character actions that do it for me.
